meanings.definition: A verb meaning to overturn or tip over.
meanings.sent1: The cowps of the vase startled everyone.
meanings.sent2: The cowps of the books made a loud noise.
meanings.sent3: The cowps of the chair caused a small commotion.
meanings.sent4: The cowps of the cup echoed through the room.
meanings.sent5: The cowps of the table were unexpected and sudden.

meanings.definition: A noun referring to a fall or tumble.
meanings.sent1: She couldn't prevent the cowps on the icy sidewalk.
meanings.sent2: The cowps down the hill were inevitable.
meanings.sent3: His cowps during the race were quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: The cowps of the leaves in autumn are beautiful.
meanings.sent5: The cowps of the acrobat amazed the audience.

meanings.definition: An adjective describing something that is overturned or toppled.
meanings.sent1: The cowps chair lay on its side.
meanings.sent2: The cowps tree blocked the path.
meanings.sent3: The cowps toy looked funny on the shelf.
meanings.sent4: The cowps box spilled its contents.
meanings.sent5: The cowps boat floated upside down in the pond.
